column1: Speaker Pelosi has doubled down on her “nothing is better than something” approach to COVID relief.  This has been Pelosi’s game for months: hold needed relief hostage for radical unrelated policies while small businesses unemployed Americans and families suffer. https://t.co/tra8p2yZPt
Even CNN catching on to the fact that COVID relief is being blocked for one reason and one reason only: Democrats in Congress. https://t.co/9Q1Crdoq9Q

Democrat leaders have repeatedly blocked COVID relief for small businesses unemployed Americans and a country still struggling through this pandemic.  They’ve put partisan politics above helping people and we’re not going to forget it. https://t.co/ZXwS5GEw1g

Thank you @harrishealth for your support. COVID is an unprecedented challenge facing our community and I’ve been proud to work alongside you to protect the health and safety of Houstonians - especially our vulnerable communities - during this pandemic. https://t.co/NpW67jAai7

We have seen this movie before.   Every time our country is in need of further COVID relief Republicans step up to help our small businesses our health care workers and unemployed Americans.  And every time without fail Democrats block this needed relief. Shameless. https://t.co/Q8Wk3ucqSI

New episode   Dr. @Avik Roy joins us for a pragmatic look at America’s approach to the COVID-19 response thus far and how we can learn from the past eight months to better prepare ourselves for the future.  https://t.co/DuCEKZuqJ3 https://t.co/i1Fz59t9Kn

Another reminder that congressional Democrats have repeatedly blocked targeted relief for small businesses unemployed Americans and our health care workers still battling COVID-19.  They’re about to do it again. https://t.co/xNUHAlTcnY

Toured Houston Methodist to get a first hand look at their innovative use of convalescent plasma to treat COVID patients.  It’s not a miracle cure but just one more way that Houston innovators are helping battle COVID-19 and beat this pandemic. https://t.co/huo0yeqCKF

Joe Biden and Democrats like to say “no miracle is coming” on COVID-19. They want you to stay scared and stay locked down.  But we’re relying on American innovation to find a vaccine through Operation Warp Speed. Watch https://t.co/Ei4pCIYj5R

New episode - How the media spins a pandemic.  @RichLowry returns to examine the mainstream media's manipulative (and often absurd) coverage of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/0SF7aLwNa8 https://t.co/21R09Vv01W
Pelosi “leadership” on full display here.  Holding COVID relief hostage for weeks is exhausting work so of course they essentially gave themselves the next month off. https://t.co/ZLfIxyHGkM

Houston innovators at it again.  Was proud to work with Nuro on an exemption from needless government regulations that were holding their operations back. Now they’re putting their next generation tech to good use to help our community during COVID.   Worth the read: https://t.co/rTvAxylv7Y

Good reminder from POLITICO today about the Democrat negotiating position on COVID relief throughout this crisis:  Intransigent hostage takers who refuse to find middle ground. Even when Americans are suffering. https://t.co/Xx87HSStpz

Facts not fear  Dr. Reynolds Delgado a cardiologist at Baylor St. Luke's Medical Center/Texas Heart Institute joins me for a conversation about what doctors like himself are learning as they treat patients on the front lines of the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/gKxz8hmwuT https://t.co/rnzkGHqy19

Democrat leaders don’t care about getting people back to work or helping small businesses. They don’t care about finding a solution to unemployment insurance.  These are the same Democrats who held bipartisan COVID relief hostage for weeks. Twice.   They’re doing it again now. https://t.co/7kS8bQH9iV

You keep hearing without any evidence that we had “no national plan” to combat COVID. But that has never been true and ignores the significant steps taken by the federal government and private industry.  @SteveScalise debunks the myth: https://t.co/GIHIDFF4Ow

Economic recovery must be a primary focus of the upcoming COVID relief package. We must target resources to undo the damage of lockdowns.  Helping people get back to work and helping businesses open safely is critical to reviving the economy as effectively as possible. https://t.co/VlVb9npTVR

People are understandably scared - about their health families and jobs - when it comes to COVID.  But we need straightforward contextualized facts from our leaders. Not panicked rhetoric or finger pointing.  We can get through this together and we’re doing that in Texas. https://t.co/PrxDtH0Le7

Good leaders must seek balance as we fight COVID together. I believe Governor Abbott is doing just that.   We can continue to flatten the curve AND protect our livelihoods. We MUST do both and we are. Houston hospitalizations continue to trend downward. Keep it up Texas. https://t.co/WBHigjse1c

We aren’t out of the woods yet but hospitalization data from Texas Medical Center this week is encouraging.   We must keep it up - do our part to wear masks and social distance - to keep bending this curve down.   Together we can beat this and make sure we never lock down again. https://t.co/UlQCdBvU0L

The left argues that shutting down the economy again is the only solution to address the spike in COVID cases.   This single-minded approach to this challenge is dangerous because it ignores the severe harms of lockdowns to public health education and livelihoods.   WATCH https://t.co/FstW95WjZE

The growth rate for COVID-19 hospitalizations in Houston are trending in the right direction right now.  We still need to take precautions - like wearing masks and social distancing - but the data show that our hospitals are not being overrun.   The dangerous rhetoric must stop. https://t.co/AWFnDJYi55

Texas still has one of the lowest death rates in the entire country. Our case fatality rate is just 1.23%  New York has 10x the COVID-19 deaths of Texas. 164 deaths per 100000 vs 11 deaths per 100000  CA’s spike in cases is as bad as Texas even though their lockdown was longer

A few key stats today as we are facing COVID-19 in Houston  Daily hospital growth rate is just .2% down from 5.2% just a week ago   We are still in “Phase 2” of our ICU surge capacity plan.   Just 9% of our Phase 2 capacity is full  Phase 3 is not expected in the next two weeks

“It’s not just the health and medical impacts from COVID. It’s this real socioeconomic sociodemographic impact across the communities.”  Fully agree with Dr. Shah. We can’t ignore the economic educational and other public health impacts of universal lockdowns as we fight COVID https://t.co/kE4dPK6LHY
Democrats just passed a bill that would make it harder for American innovators to develop a COVID-19 vaccine.  Here’s what you need to know: https://t.co/lEi2G5Qsj8
A lot of politicians are using new COVID-19 cases in Texas to scare people.  So we need to get some facts straight and provide some context.   Watch:   1/2 https://t.co/VErWk8oTAr

Federal support for COVID-19 testing sites in Houston is being extended and we are thankful to HHS for doing so.   But the fear-mongering and disinformation over the transition to local control - something Texas was fully prepared for - was unacceptable.    Here’s the truth: https://t.co/dmX1FfN3yT

The human toll of indefinite lockdowns school closures and other fear-based responses to COVID-19 are hard to quantify. Dr. Scott Atlas of the Hoover Institution joins me to break down the impact of misguided strategies so we don’t repeat these mistakes. https://t.co/BfZjKvcVht https://t.co/eRbhMdDNEG

In response to COVID-19 we’ve seen draconian lockdowns & excessive punishments for activities that were perfectly legal until recently. Do these measures violate our constitutional liberties? Professor Randy Barnett of Georgetown Law joins me to discuss.  https://t.co/qsQzpFLg14 https://t.co/1i2067KN0o

Great to join “Mattress Mack” in launching his initiative to help Texans find meaningful work. This is critical after COVID-19.  By boosting job training and addressing underlying causes of joblessness this will help Texans get back on their feet. https://t.co/aRmu5AYGbj

Universal & indefinite lockdowns were a misguided response to COVID-19. A lack of critical thinking cost millions of people their livelihoods.  This isn’t about blaming anyone but instead acknowledging this fact so that we do not repeat the same mistakes in the future.  WATCH https://t.co/z8v05ORlih

New episode  I take you behind the scenes of our country’s strategy in the war against COVID-19 with one of the top officials at the front lines: Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response Dr. Robert Kadlec.   DOWNLOAD  https://t.co/cCDLgiI3yO https://t.co/t2azSu6Ka8

The federal reserve is playing a key role in our economic recovery from COVID-19. But what exactly is the purpose of America’s central bank? Robert Kaplan the head of the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas joins me to answer these questions & more:  DOWNLOAD https://t.co/JAR2sARibT https://t.co/TfcAIffmr4

The CCP is scared.   Now their mouthpiece is suggesting that I’ll be sanctioned for trying to hold the communist regime accountable for allowing the coronavirus to spread across the world.  Reality check: We’re not intimidated. We’re not backing down. https://t.co/THlWWWbFYa

New episode  How do we revive the American economy in the aftermath of COVID-19? Economist Dr. John Diamond of Rice University joins me to examine our current economic state and what’s on the horizon for businesses and labor markets.   DOWNLOAD: https://t.co/Dbu1djjWoO https://t.co/okuYUlTk3S

Check out my Sunday Conversation with @HoustonChron on lessons learned from the COVID-19 pandemic the need to reopen our economy and get people back to work and other issues impacting Texans and people across the country. https://t.co/yDdt40gSA6

How do we address threats to our economic prosperity and civil liberties after COVID-19? How should local leaders encourage people to properly risk mitigate (hint: don’t throw moms in jail)?   Kay Coles James joins me to discuss all of this and more.  https://t.co/jyLdvj5XWJ https://t.co/yLG91XqJW8

Compounding pharmacies help lower drug costs and provide innovative care in our communities. Now they’re at the forefront of our response to COVID-19. I toured Empower Pharmacy a compounding pharmacy in Houston and know the vital work they are doing. https://t.co/PWfAFeYmIV

Hiding in perpetuity in the face of this pandemic was never an option despite the claims of some. Now that we have a better understanding of this virus it’s time to confront the risk of COVID-19 head on. So how do we do that?  WATCH https://t.co/LgMKOrJYMy

“Nothing can bring back the tens of thousands of American lives cut short by the coronavirus... Still China should be held accountable for unleashing a global catastrophe.”  Good read in @WashTimes on my bill with @SenTomCotton to hold China accountable. https://t.co/QTIQpxz0U0

New episode  Deputy Secretary of Health and Human Services Eric Hargan takes us to the front lines of the battle against coronavirus to answer key questions about our strategy to beat this global pandemic.  DOWNLOAD https://t.co/w7w71yYQZe https://t.co/RpKxRljEVH

Millions of Americans face increasing economic challenges in the face of COVID-19 and questions are looming about how best to respond. Dr. Russ Roberts of the Hoover Institution joins me to discuss a path forward for the economy and jobs after COVID-19 https://t.co/uTkUh9GYGP https://t.co/WcbXcRFsbS

Why was funding for small businesses delayed (again)? I go behind the scenes with @GOPLeader to discuss why Democrats keep playing politics with coronavirus relief.
